name: Beachside Resort Kawana Waters

reviews.text: I stayed with my sister for a visit to see family. The self contained 2 bedroom apartment with two bathrooms we stayed in was well equipped, very clean and tastefully furnished. Our apartment had a large balcony overlooking Kawana Waters Surf Beach, with the Surf Club providing meals and entertainment, if required. Within walking was the Kawana Waters Shopping Centre with a large variety of outlets. The Managers were very pleasant and helpful with anything we asked of them. Undercover car parking was supplied with each apartment. As this was my second visit to Beachside Resort, I would recommend it to my friends. Thank you James & Carol.
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay, close to beach, parks and central to attractions.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner booked this place for a romantic getaway. He booked a one bedroom apartment which was roomy, located near a beach, surf club and major shopping centre, however the decore was very date and tired looking. Our major complaint with this place was there was no main bathroom available for our use, the door was locked. We did enquire why and were told we would have to pay more if we wanted to use the bath....so all we had was an ensuite with shower, pity as a couple of bubble baths together were high on our agenda. I found this to be totally 'out of the norm' from any other place we have stayed. I would say the main reason was possibly cost cutting with the cleaning. Pity we hadn't been told this prior to booking. As mentioned, the decor was really dated...probably early 80's, the sofa's, bedspread and pictures on the wall were all very aged. I'm sure it wouldn't cost a great deal to update them. The pillows were like rocks as well. I wouldn't go back here, or recommend it to couples wanting to snuggle up in nice surroundings.
reviews.title: Forget about a romantic bubble bath!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay and did not want to leave. The staff treated us with utter courtesy and friendlyness. The extremely spacious unit had a house-sized kitchen complete with dishwasher, appliances & full cooking facilities. Our huge balcony gave us a stunning view overlooking the beautiful green oval and children's playground between the hotel and the ocean. We watched the sunrise every morning and countless ships and sailing boats passing by. Within walking distance of shopping centre & restaurants. The resort is situated in a quiet area and we enjoyed good nights' rest.
reviews.title: Highly recommend

reviews.text: I enjoyed my stay. The staff was friendly. The balcony was huge and had a stunning view over looking kawana. The unit was spacious and had a house sized kitchen which was great to see. The only fault would be that the couch was broken, the room and lift had an unpleasant smell and the TV wasnt digital which was a shame as I missed a week of my favourite shows! Otherwise I look forward to coming back.
reviews.title: Nice Place

reviews.text: Can't fault the place . Friendly staff . Very clean premises and rooms and beautifully kept grounds . Extremely spacious units with house-sized kitchens . Even twin ovens , you can cook up a storm . And so central to mall shopping , restaurants , bars , RSA / surf club and patrolled beach . All this within 5 minutes walk . Yet situated in a quiet area for a good night's rest .
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Carol and James, the RESIDENT MANAGERS could not be more helpful, as are their staff. Our fully self contained1BR apt was on the 6th floor and catered for all our needs, was most comfortable with modern decor. The location of the RESORT is perfect, across the road from the beach and SURF CLUB, which guests are welcomed for meals and drinks. A major SHOPPING CENTRE is only a short walk. Easy travel to all surrounding beach areas and NOOSA, NAMBOUR, MONTVILLE & MALENY. The RESORT has a gym and there is a walking track alongside the beach. A quiet and very handy location for a complete rest or walk, fish, bowls or golf. We will return.
reviews.title: We did not want to leave

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at beachside resort for four nights. I enjoyed the location and easy access to everything. I would recommend hiring a car if you dont have your own as there are plenty of things to see around the area. Noosa is not too far to the north and Montville in the Sunshine Coast hinterland was a highlight of our trip. The resort itself is right across the road from the beach and bike track in one direction and easy walk to a shopping centre in the other direction. Maloolaba is also not too far away and great for cafes and boutique shopping
reviews.title: Nice place, great for families.
Excellent experience
reviews.text: We could not fault our stay. Initially I thought it could have been a bit out of the way when booking, not having any local knowledge. Yes it is away from the many resorts further up. However that suited us, less people and tourist hype pleasantly quiet and SO!!! relaxing. No need to get in the car if you don't wish to. Walk to the shopping complex, beach and restaurants that were reasonably priced. The apartment was affordable, roomy and well equipped with a great ocean view and a lovely sea breeze. The Managers were very accommodating and welcoming.

We stayed a weekend recently and thought the managers were lovely. The 3br apartment was spacious and clean and the beds were comfy - all of which tick the most important boxes. The Manager James recommended a good local restaurant - Portside seafood which was about 10 mins walk from the apartment with good food very reasonably priced. I would stay there again. The Kawana Waters surf club across the road also had one of the best steak sandwiches I've ever had.
reviews.title: Great place, nice managers

reviews.text: My only criticism was that the manager did not give good advice re local public transport (we were there for the Cold Chisel concert). He recommended we walk the 3.5km to the venue as there was little public transport. We did this, only to see several local buses pass us on the way to the venue. There was also on-site parking at the venue for only $5 - which he failed to mention.
reviews.title: The Best Resort To Spent Holiday!!!

reviews.text: From the moment u step in to the Resort Carol & James is indeed a good host to the Resort. I would recommend this Resort to anyone, the Resort is Xcellent in service < Hospitality is indeed the best, Relaxing and value for money... AAA+++ Highly Recomended The best Resort and Buddina..
reviews.title: Peaceful and relaxing.

reviews.text: I have just had four perfect relaxing days at Beachside. It was the first time for me and my wife and our new baby boy. It was what we needed - peaceful, no hassles, an easy walk across the park to the beach; just as easy to the main shopping centre. Good coffee shops just a stroll away - the unit was reasonably priced and everything worked.
reviews.title: GREAT PLACE.... beyond poor service

reviews.text: The accommodation is a little tired and old. It's directly opposite the Kawana Surf Club but it's a little out of the way from everything else. It's directly behind the large Shopping Centre and there are a few small restaurants close by.
reviews.title: A little tired

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did spend some time in Mooloolaba and would have stayed here as it is surrounded by restaurants and cafe's and closer to the beach. There is a lot more to do.
reviews.title: This should be 3 star not 4

reviews.text: The parking in the resort is great but the rooms and fittings are basic and old. The Shower in our room just didn't work which was annoying. When we reported it when we left, the man didn't seem to worried. No apology or any other offer. We had to drive everywhere which was a problem and there isn't much to do locally other than the beach.
reviews.title: Classic example of the malaise in Australia's holiday accommodation

reviews.text: If you are staying in the area, look closer to Mooloolaba.
reviews.title: Family reunion

reviews.text: My partner and I stayed at this 'resort' for one night the first weekend in May. Considering it is not a popular destination or in a big town you wouldn't expect to pay much but I think we paid around $140 for the night and we booked on Wotif.com. The rooms are outdated, the bed was uncomfortable and there were no soaps or shampoos/ conditioners for our use in the bathroom. I think they are overselling this place for what it is and need to change their 4 star to a 3. I would come here again but only if the price for a room was dropped as you are paying too much for what it is.
reviews.title: Comfortable and Quiet

description: Mediterranean styled seven story building with 36 apartments right on patrolled beach. Peaceful area close to all amenities and attractions of the Sunshine Coast. Surf club and major shopping within a short walk. Apartments are A/C & fully self contained with kitchens and laundry. Resort has outdoor pool, spa, sauna, gym, games room, BBQ area and full size floodlit tennis court. Cable TV, lift and secure basement parking.
